meanings.definition: To carry or transport (someone or something) on one's back.
meanings.sent1: The little girl piggybacked on her father during the hike.
meanings.sent2: The tired toddler piggybacked home after a long day at the park.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy piggybacked on the cat, much to the cat's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The idea of teamwork piggybacked on the concept of unity.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hero piggybacking the injured soldier to safety stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: To be carried or transported on someone's back.
meanings.sent1: The backpack piggybacked on the student as he walked to school.
meanings.sent2: The tired child piggybacked home from the playground on his mom's shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey piggybacked on the zookeeper, causing laughter among the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project piggybacked on the hard work of the team.
meanings.sent5: The memory of being piggybacked by my older brother made me smile.

meanings.definition: To be attached or added to something else for convenience or support.
meanings.sent1: The new feature piggybacked onto the existing software seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The extra luggage piggybacked onto the main suitcase for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The joke piggybacked on the previous one, creating a chain of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The rumor piggybacked on the truth, distorting the facts.
meanings.sent5: The vines piggybacked up the wall, creating a beautiful green curtain.
